intro: Isotrema panamense, commonly known as the Panamanian isotrema, is a flowering plant native to Central America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and showy, five-petaled flowers that range in color from white to pink. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. Isotrema panamense is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and limited distribution.
